data.event: After 1781, it belonged to Klinsky Uyezd of Moscow Governorate.
The factory served for a long time as the main employer in Kozlovo.
On July 12 1929, Moscow Governorate was abolished, and the area was transferred to Moscow Oblast.
On July 23, 1930, the okrugs were abolished, and the districts were directly subordinated to the oblast.
On January 29, 1935 Kalinin Oblast was established, and Zavidovsky District was transferred to Kalinin Oblast.

event.title: December 1941, during World War II, Kozlovo was occupied

data.event: In November and December 1941, during World War II, Kozlovo was occupied by German troops.
In 1958, Kozlovo was granted urban-type settlement status.

event.title: November 14, 1960 the district was abolished and merged

data.event: On November 14, 1960 the district was abolished and merged into Konakovsky District.

event.title: February 13, 1963, during the abortive Khrushchyov administrative reform, Konakovsky District was merged

data.event: On February 13, 1963, during the abortive Khrushchyov administrative reform, Konakovsky District was merged into Kalininsky District, but on January 12, 1965 it was re-established.
On February 13, 1963, during the abortive Khrushchyov administrative reform, Konakovsky District was merged into Kalininsky District, but on January 12, 1965 it was re-established.
In 1990, Kalinin Oblast was renamed Tver Oblast.
